Class Sun

java.lang.Object
Sun
public class Sun extends Object
Sun is illustrating a sun at day and a moon at night. Position and size can be set individually.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Fouad Ahsayni, Mykhailo Fakliier, Artur Konkel

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Sun(int x, int y, int radius)
    Constructor is responsible for the position x, position y and radius of the sun

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    draw(Graphics g, Color skyColor)
    The method draw is responsible for the drawing of the sun and moon (depends of the dayTime)
    boolean
    switchTime(int x, int y)
    The method switchTime is responsible for the click on the sun.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Details

    • Sun

      public Sun(int x, int y, int radius)
      Constructor is responsible for the position x, position y and radius of the sun
      Parameters:
      x - is the position of the sun on the X-axis
      y - is the position of the sun on the Y-axis
      radius - is radius of the sun

  • Method Details

    • switchTime

      public boolean switchTime(int x, int y)
      The method switchTime is responsible for the click on the sun. There is a formula for counting the area of the sun in the whole JFrame.
      Parameters:
      x - is the position of the sun on the X-axis in JFrame
      y - is the position of the sun on the Y-axis in JFrame
      Returns:
      returns the dayTime (night or day)

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g, Color skyColor)
      The method draw is responsible for the drawing of the sun and moon (depends of the dayTime)
      Parameters:
      g - is the variable which is responsible for drawing of the sun and the moon
      skyColor - is the color of the sky
